name: Contradiction - Spot The Liar!
description: Spot the lie and beat the liars in 'Contradiction' - the all-video murder mystery adventure!

reviews.review_text: Being a detective is not an easy job to do especially when you find more questions than answers. Your goal is to interview the people and search for the clues to make them together into one piece of evidence. Step after step get deeper into strange behaviour and rituals that occurs at nearest business training course building. There is more than meets the eye, but it's hard to tell what exactly is going on and every suspect act suspicious enough so it's hard to tell who is lying. To progress with the plot we search for the contradictions and stand them side by side to confront with suspect. Acting is the main part that will drive the story, add some mystery music and we are set. Contradiction is hard, but it also gives a nice involving story. The Ending makes a good opening for the sequel.

There is a certain level of charm exclusive to FMV games. I hated them back then, but now they're all endearing in their own special way. With the computer graphics of today, we can achieve practically anything. That really isn't as exciting as it used to be. Maybe I'm just getting old. I'd probably start yelling at clouds, but I never go outside. Whatever the case, Contradiction - Spot the Liar! is a great example of what the medium is capable of.  Detective Inspector Jenks is tasked with solving the mysterious death of a young woman. Over the course of a single night, he will collect evidence, interview suspects, and discover contradictions. In terms of game-design, the process isn't complicated in any way. Take the Phoenix Wright series for example. In those games, your primary method of progression is tied to spotting contradictions. If you mess up, you're punished with a loss of 'life'. There are no punishments for mistakes in this game. You can even take as much time as you need to solve the mystery. I appreciate the more casual approach to this investigation. Due to my cautious nature, I tend to save every couple minutes in the Ace Attorney games, which really hurts the pacing.   An aspect that I really enjoy about this game is it can feel like nothing is really happening. I compare it to the Gene Hackman movie 'The French Connection'. If you take out the car/L-train chase and the shoot-out at the end, you're left with nearly an hour and a half of 'boring' police work. A lot of attention is paid to the characters, and how their mostly fruitless investigation plays out. You'll go through a similar process in this game. With every new piece of evidence, you'll end up asking everyone what they might know about it. Some won't know anything at all, but you're still treated to an answer. The person you're questioning might also make an odd quip or comment. Even if they don't have anything to do with the investigation, these character moments add a lot of personality.   That's why I strongly suggest that - unless you're well and truly stuck - you don't use a guide for this game. Aside from spoiling the answers, you're also taking away the immersive qualities of this game. A lot of the detective work in this game could be considered dull, but that's usually how it goes in the real world. Often the evidence won't consist of something significant like a murder weapon or a fingerprint. In any case, since you're essentially working to solve this mystery in a single night, you won't have access to a bunch of CSI gadgets. All you really can do is think about what everyone tells you, and weed out the red herrings.  This game was made on a budget of 3,000 pounds. 3,000! The more I think about it the crazier it sounds. Some of the voice recordings sound a little off, and the 'night' scenes were filmed in the day-time, but otherwise there's nothing that really stuck out as cheaply done. The acting is fine as well, though you're liable to remember Rupert Booth's (Jenks) 1,001 facial expressions most of all. He makes even the most banal scenes amusing.   Definitely give this game a look, especially if it's already in your library. Please buy this game. I NEED MORE OF THIS AMAZING FMV ACTING.
Amazing game - finished it in one sitting. Could not stop playing until I finished the story, Hope this is the first of many in this series.

I really loved this game.  I am a big fan of FMV games and yes, this one really hit it out of the ball park.  The acting was amazing and the story fascinating.  The game navigation was really good  (there WERE a couple of hiccups(mainly when I tried to exit the pub, but as the game was so good I could easily overlook this)  Loved the locale(english villages are awesome for murder mysteries) and the music was very good as well   I really really hope the ending indicated that there will be more....  I would gladly support a kickstarter for it....

Really enjoyed it. The acting was great, the story was interesting, the puzzles made sense. The central mechanic of finding inconsistencies in people’s stories works pretty well. It’s so much more enjoyable than QTEs, minigames or the typical adventure game thing of collecting random items and combining them in weird ways.  The one thing I didn’t like is the way you have to keep revisiting the same locations over and over again just to see if anything has changed. This repetitive process pads out the length of the game considerably.  Two of the hardest contradictions to spot (for me) were at the very end of the game, so I’d say it’s pretty well balanced difficulty-wise. By the way, if you do get badly stuck, but don’t want to cheat, I’d recommend rewatching the cutscenes: at least two of the contradictions rely on remembering minor details you could have easily forgotten about if you’re not playing the game in one sitting.
Excellent game, and longer than I expected for a 100% FMV, 10€ game (took me seven hours!).  Heartily recommended!

Full motion video was quite the rage for a brief time in the mid 90's. Outside of Tex Murphy though few developers got it right. Contradiction brings back everything that was good about FMV gaming while avoiding most if not all of its negatives. For a low budget game this has very good acting and a fairly polished and easy to use interface. There is just something very appealing about getting to play the detective and this story has a lot of interesting clues and sub plots that keep you driving to a solution. The basic gameplay premise works very well. Collect clues, interview subjects and spot contradictions in their testimony. This is much more challenging than you would think as you end up with a large amount of testimony from several suspects throughout the 7 to 8 hour experience and finding the contradictions as you get towards the end can be very challenging. You also end up with a large number of red herrings that can distract you from what is important in the information you uncover. There are a couple of hint systems available in the game, but it's very satisfying to work through the testimony on your own to find the solution.  Pros: HD quality video and solid acting Smooth interface that is easy to navigate once you get the key commands down. Backtracking is helped by map that allows you to quickly return to locations Very interesting mystery that keeps you pushing towards the solution  Cons: Audio is a bit over compressed causing it to be tinny. Hopefully this is fixed in a later update. Story ends with many of the subplots unresolved, but open to a possible sequel.  Controller support broken on Windows currently.   You will have to backtrack and speak to suspects over and over as you unlock more clues. This part does have some of the downsides of old 90’s games, but I enjoyed Inspector Jenks so much I didn’t mind and was willing to overlook this. Also, over the course of the many in game hours of interviews the suspects will mostly be in the same places. Drinks will stay the same level and suspects will stare into the same fireplaces. This can take you a bit out of the experience, but I’m sure all the dialog was recorded at the same time and this was necessary for the game design.  Overall this is one of the best FMV and Mystery titles ever made and is quite the achievement on the very small budget the game was made with. I can only hope the game does well enough to make a sequel possible. Game is well worth the asking price.

Contradiction is simply the best game I have played for years. It takes a unique perspective on adventure gaming with a solid story, excellent music and an interesting location. The performances from all the actors are very enjoyable and I thoroughly recommend this game to all. In terms of sheer value for money, this is worth every penny. I hope there are several sequals here - the mechanic of the contradictions you find in the video clips was novel and I would love to see this further developed in a future release. In short - this game is highly captivating, the mechanics are deeply rewarding and it sticks in your mind long after finishing.

This was really a ton of fun. I was a bit wary at first because I was afraid you wouldn't really be doing very much actual playing, but the contradictions are so fun to dig out and it always feels like an accomplishment to exult in when you catch someone in a lie. It really is one of the best games I've played this year and it has left me satisfied but still wanting more. I'm very excited to see a sequel.  It does have its weak points, but most mystery plots do. You will find yourself yelling at characters to notice things that seem so obvious but they totally ignore. But if it can happen to Sherlock I can forgive them a bit. It did not take away from the enjoyment for me at all.  The acting is spot on. If you like British television, especially their mysteries, or really any sort of whodunnit style entertainment then this will be right up your alley. It has all the intrigue with a hint of the macabre lurking around every corner. There are campy characters who you will find yourself laughing out loud at constantly and ones with such gravitas that you actually find yourself shrinking back in your seat in intimidation.  So yeah, this is well worth the $10 and the 6-8 hours of your time for a playthrough. I would not say there is much in terms of replay value, but I did finish with 96% completion and am really curious to see what I missed. I would love for them to allow you to go back and conduct interviews after the finale just so you can try to find that elusive contradiction.

This game is one of the best adventure games of the last decade (admittedly , there hasn't been a lot of good adventure games in the last decade). Totaly recommend! The acting is great, the story is compelling and the gameplay is challenging enough to give you a few hours of thoroughly enjoyable experience.

I'm very glad to see the full video adventure games making a come back, thanks to the technology we now have for the actual data storage means and thanks to less expensive video cameras and such. These full video games had emerged eons ago with the CD storage but quickly died because of being terribly expensive to film and because the CD storage wasn't good enough; videos weren't compressed or anything and quickly filled a cd with barely anything. 5 CDs games were legions and were quickly hated for being cumbersome and annoying to use. Now thanks to a better technology the videos won't rip your eyes out as they did in the past (interlaced mode videos were deadly! ^^) and they can feature more than one hour of filming. And with the digitalized era, we don't have to fiddle with the numerous CDs or DVDs or anything anymore; a couple of clicks on Steam and you're set! Yes, a game all filmed is terribly kitsch but it will have better characters - you do relate more to human beings than to pixels after all.   Contradiction have a good story, even though it's rather classical it's really well told and unfolded brilliantly. It has good characters and the gameplay of spotting the contradictions is quite effective and fun! Of course it will be a bit harder for non-English native players but it's still doable - if I did it, anyone can lol. The music is good. The game settings slowly going from day to night is clever and effective. The game lasted 7 hours and it was really a fun ride!  In the forum the dev talked about making another similar game, I can't wait! More, please!!

What a great wee gem of a game. The original generation of FMVs are a bit before my time, but I understand that the tech often didn't live up to the ambition. Well, that one's more area where grasp has now caught up to vision. The video works beautifully with well-chosen angles and smooth movement between shots. The characters are well-cast and well-rounded - it feels like an interactive BBC drama - and the contradiction game play works really well. The setting feels genuinely eerie and tense without being heavy-handed, and the ominous atmosphere only built as the sun went down (lovely touch, by the way). It's challenging enough to cause some head-scratching without becoming completely frustrating (see the Steam walkthrough if you need it - the cheats function doesn't appear to work). The game's plot kep me guessing, tying the main investigation up at the end while creating an intriguing world that I hope will be built upon in further installments.  There are a couple of things Pneuma could do to improve. Auto-playing the prologue video when the game starts would help set the scene for the player. As it is currently, you just land in front of the pub feeling a little confused. A run through of the controls at the start would also benefit the game. I was told to use the 'investigation' and the 'inventory' buttons by text boxes, however, there had been no explanation what these were ('s' and 'enter'). That said, there are control instructions on the Menu screen so it's easy enough to figure out. Going back to the Prologue Video, there's a fair bit of unnecessary exposition. In the next game I'd cut this down to scene-setting only and let the game do the rest of the work (which it does, very well). Last point, a couple of the scenes where Jenks attempts to assert his authority felt a little silly. A bit more research into police descalation techniques would help remedy this.   All of the above are just suggested improvements and don't detract from the fact that I enjoyed playing this game a lot. So much so, I completed it in a single sitting (lovely way to spend Sunday). I look forward to returning to the world of Contradiction and finding out more about the clandestine workings of the Atlas Institute.
Transcends the meme status of most FMV games and left me with an unforgettable experience that I crave more of.
awesome. essentially a 5 hour murder mystery that you drive

Easily the best FMV I've ever played. I found all the characters to be interesting enough to care about. Jenks (the main character) had enough funny facial expressions to keep me fueled for more murder solving! This is easily the most fun I've had in any game like this. Would recommend to anyone who is capable of enjoying a point and click adventure.

A very quirky, interesting, and over all else charming modern FMV adventure game. The cast are great and their performances really make the experience fun, and they're well aware of what they're up to and are part of the jokey nature of it all.  You've got an evening to solve the mystery of a girl's apparent suicide in a small English village. You do this by wandering around talking to the various characters available to you, and picking the contradictions in their accounts, while gathering evidence where you can. It's a streamlined process, and the fact that the video is such high quality makes it all very slick - once you get used to the controls.  The couple downsides are the slightly inconsistent audio quality, and the slight drop off of the story towards the conclusion - but these are small quibbles.  Overall a very enjoyable, fun, warm adventure, and I hope to see a sequel with the same actors, even if playing different characters.

A delightful throwback to FMV adventure games, with some trademark british camp. Thoroughly enjoyable and lighthearted despite the serious topic of, you know, murder. Other than some bad interface and control issues I have no problem recommending this game, as long as you know what you're getting in to.
I love how awful the lead actor is! Put this guy in more corny FMV adventure games!

Oh boy.  Without spoiling anything, it's an incredibly well-written murder mystery game with a fantastic sequel hook. I didn't know it was even possible to make FMV games THIS good. I'd love to see a sequel!

An awesome game. Different from other thinking games, and with a good hint-system. Very addictive, and makes you feel like a detective.   At first I thought the detective was a bit silly, but thoughout the game I really started to like the guy. He's got a great personality, and it's great acting, both from him and the other characters in the game.  The ending could have been more concluding, there's a lot of questions still unanswered, but that's not a problem as long as they make a sequel. I'll definitely support you. :)

Midsomer Murders on PCP seem attractive to you? You've come to the right place!  I can't praise Contradiction highly enough. It not only picks up the baton of FMV adventure games but charges towards you with it, waving and yelling as it goes.  Funny, camp, clever and perfectly pitched. A gem.

Very much enjoyed this. Gameplay was fun, story was interesting. Loved all the actors and the parts. Acting was completely over the top which was brilliant as it really suited the game. Somehow I managed to complete it without any cheats or calls.  Really hope to see further entries in the series! :)
Buy it already so we can get the second one. Because we need it.
I watched Jesse and Dodger play this and it was awesome so I had to give it a go myself.

This game is amazing. Seriously, the amount that they did, the story they tell, with just the kickstarted funds, is phenomenal. The acting is somehow /not/ as hokey and second hand embarrassing as i'm used to with these types of games, and I literally sat here and finished the entire game in one go because I really really needed to see what was next. Jenks is fantastic; an awesome mix of sarcastic, confident, smart, and down to earth that makes him a very easy character to want to follow.  Honestly, if I had the money to fund an entire sequal myself, I would give it to them because I would /love/ to see what they did next. Sadly, I'm but a poor college student, but I absolutely want this to happen.

Contradiction: Spot the Liar will inevitably be compared to Her Story, since they are likely the only two new FMV games people have played in the past 15 years. While I enjoyed Her Story, it was rather bare bones with only one actress and one location. Contradiction fleshes out this concept with a full cast and a realistic English village for the player to explore. While the game isn’t scary, there exists a sense of foreboding throughout the town, I absolutely loved the atmosphere. The acting in this game is very well done, whoever was responsible for the casting nailed it on all counts.   This game is probably best played in no more than 2 or 3 sittings while everybody’s answers are fresh in your mind. I got stuck a few times, but that was because halfway through the game I took a few days off and forgot what I saw and what people told me.   The gameplay mechanic gets a bit unweildly the end of the game as there are rather extensive lists to question people with. I would have at least liked to have seen the one time use items removed from the inventory after they served their purpose. I really liked the three tier hint system. If you click the hint button, your will be given a minor hint telling you if you missed anything obvious. For more substantial help, you can always call the chief and he will give you more pointed guidance. (Even though you never see him, I thought the chief was a great minor character as he exasperatedly explains himself over the telephone.) And if you are really stuck, there is a cheat button in the main menu which tells you exactly where to go and what to do.  I’m glad developers like this are starting to try FMV games again, they really look and feel much better than they used to, with good acting, crisp imagery and seamless transitions without load times.   Rating 9/10.

I really liked the flow and way this was filmed and the story flowed for me quite nicely. Id love to see a sequal for this and would definately buy it. The video is clear, I didnt encounter any bugs and the acting was really well done.

Amazing game! Wonderful experience. Definitely worth $10. Can’t wait for the possible sequel.

I watched Jesse Cox and Dodger play some of this game and I was incredibly excited to play it, but I've been waiting for it to load for over half an our now. The sound still plays in the background, but the loading sign just stays there. It doesn't even change colors anymore. Why won't the game load? Every other game I've downloaded works.

Contradition is a wonderfully charming game which makes the player feel as though they are in a detective drama like Midsomer Murder or a modern interpretation of an Agatha Christie novel. The characters are likeable and the cinematic approach to this type of game is quite refreshing compared to the more static and traditional (and still fun) point-and-click mystery games.  I would definitely recommend this game to those who are fans of British detective dramas.

Given that this game was made on a tiny budget and sold for a cost that turns out, I believe to be excellent value for $, the quality of work is very high indeed. I'm very interested in seeing a sequel, and hope there are enough mystery buffs out there like myself that feel the same so it will happen.  Side note: I love Jenks, he's a very amusing character that reminded me of some of my favorite Dr. Who characters in recent history with his mannerisms & enthusiasm for his job.
quite good overall, sadly sometimes the game would crash so save it often to avoid a progress lost.
I enjoyed every moment of it! Smooth and fun gameplay, intriguing plot, mostly great acting, great soundtrack. Took me 12 hours to finish (no cheats used). Thumbs up for a sequel!
This was a game.  Little buggy, couple coices should be a bit more flexible, but overall a pretty decent game.
Me likey, me want to blay 2nd part.

im cummmin from this great video game. I wish there was a fleshlight shaped liked Jenk's face so I could make love to him and his beautiful face. please love me Jenks, I need you in my life   i have terminal cancer

Campy detective game that I found shockingly enjoyable. There are some loose ends that still need to be tied up and I'd love play a sequel (if there ever is one…) Well worth the $9.00!!  I know I’ll be keeping an eye open they have another Kickstarter for Contradiction 2
It's Deadly Premonition, but British.  I don't know why the name is so terrible, but that's alright. I hope there are a dozen of these in a series.

A good game with some clever puzzles! Some of the actors are quite good-- some are overdoing it (which may have something to do with their direction).  The story is rubbish, though. Red herrings in a mystery game are one thing-- but massive and largely unavoidable trips into interesting, but ultimatly unfulfilled plot lines leaves you feeling like this game is the first part of a multi-part game and that the ending to this one isn't good enough to warrant your intellectual investment. After you let that feeling sit with you for a bit, you start to realize that the majority of the play time was just having you on.  That said, there's some smart social commentary in here about Ayn Rand and her brand of insanity. Rather liked that.  At the end of the day, Contradiction was engaging. And I'd look into more games like this now. FMV certainly has a place in the modern day.
Very fun game :D.
I had to buy this game after seeing someone play it. I even bought extra copies for friends.I hope there's a sequel where James recognizes the mask. Or any sequel. Please. \m/

Really enjoyable. If you can be patient and allow yourself to sit back or leave the game a bit, to mull over those difficult 'who is currently lying in what way???' moments without cheating or asking the chief, it is so worth it.   Yes there's a lot of running around to the same spots and people over and over until you finally click onto what you need to do, but it's not meant to be easy or done in like 2 hours.  I'm on midnight now, haven't quite finished, but I'm worried that if there's a twist, it's in something that will probably come up very soon in everyone's investigations and is pretty damn obvious. I hope I'm wrong, because the rest of the game has been great!  A few hiccups with the mouse suddenly not being able to click on any statements during an interview, unless you leave and then come back to the same person. I noticed that this happened at exactly the same point as Dodger and Jesse Cox's playthrough at one point, I think when talking to Ryan earlier in the night. So I guess it's a little bug? Nothing game-breaking through.

A simple must play. If you enjoy murder mysteries. A girl was drowned under dubious circumstances in an english town, and a inspector is investigating the death. He only has a few hours to come to the conclusion. Was it an accident, a suicide or a murder.   By talking to the main characters in the game you have to find out what's happening. That also means you have to spot the lies that those people tell you.   The game makes use of good actors and creates the right atmosphere, especially if you take the low budget they got into care. Spot on!   Let's hope they come up with a sequel...!

Great title when you like interactive movies!  Took me 6 hours to complete - the nice settings / video material / story more than justified the asking price of 9.99.  I had two small issues: - A few times I encountered a UI bug where you couldn't select a certain option and you had to first select something else for it to work - The 'transition clips' (e.g. opening a door 'Just a few questions please') get repetitive after the 100th time. And you get these everytime you re-visit a character - which you do quite often.  Nevertheless, I enjoyed the story a lot and if you do not try to finish the game in one big session you should be fine.  Recommended.

Have you seen this? Because you should. Explore a small village, pursue your leads, and you'll be rewarded with some of the most unbelievable performances of your life.  There ain't no contradiction here - go play.  \m/

This game kind of reminds me of Shenmue on a limited scale. The plot is very interesting and keep you on the verge of your seat like something I have never seen before. I just couldn't stop playing and beated the game in one seating in 6 and a half hours straight. And this comes from someone who lost faith in the gaming industry for a long time.  To add to the amusement, the act is flawless and at the same time the main character - Inspector Jenks acts like a goofball most of the times, however, somehow, it adds to the dept of his carachter. It is like he is trying to act in a mocking way in order to irritate the people he interogates.  Like Shenmue III, the game was done through crowd funding and it is impressive the amount of detail and depthness they went through with such a small budget - that is the magic of Indie development! The love that independent developers have for their creations is something that someone who only wants to make a quick buck by making a next generic sequel of a generic First Person Shooter or something.  Is the independent developers and crowd funding what will save the gaming industry? I think so.
This was one of the best FMV games I have ever played. Thank you to giantbomb for the quick look.

I like this game a lot. The atmosphere created with the graphics and music is terrific. You can't beat the graphics! My only minor pet peave is some of the contradictions can be a bit too difficult. In any event, a terrific mystery game. I hope they make a sequel!

Very nice. This was 9,99€ well spent.   The game runs without any performance issues even on my not-so-new basic laptop, the characters are different and interesting. Acting is good. The music is spot-on for this type of game: slow-paced and atmospheric.   Not much replay value to speak of since the fun of the game is unravelling the story for the first time. Making progress in the game is truly satisfying because you get to make the observations yourself, without the game being too difficult. And there's a cheat-feature anyway, in case you get stuck. I personally think that should be a standard thing in a point&click puzzle game.

8.9/10  Handcrafted and charming. It truly felt like I was in the 90's again playing a Sierra game. The gameplay can get monotonous, but you still want to push forward to the end to see how the story unfolds. The campy acting is perfect, and some exeptional production quality really pushed all the right buttons for me. There are some criticisms, but they require I go into....  ***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS***  The ending, yes, was a let down. As many people noted. For the entire thing to randomly be Rebecca felt random and just thrown out there. To add to this the cliffhanger with Atlus, while I get it's part of a series, I feel should of just been actually resolved instead of just teased that more adventures abound. All that said, the game held me enough to give the team another chance, no questions asked. Great game. Highly recommended.
Very few story driven games would be worth playing through a second time. This is one of them.

If you like Her Story, you will love this game, I just wish it were longer!  I've always enjoyed the crossover of mystery and point-and-click adventure games, and this one is nice in that it leans more towards the mystery aspect. The contradiction bit is definitely a fun mechanic. I feel like they could flesh out and add more items to use, but it all went together very nicely. I want more!   The FMV is something fun and refreshing, it is hard not to quickly fall for Jenks and his quirks. It combines typical British goofiness with a murder mystery, so it isn't over-dramatic. I have to say this is one of my favorite games, and I really hope another comes out!

The minute you find the first contradiction, you are hooked. It has a well-written storyline. Loved the balance of red-herrings and important details to keep it just complicated enough to be really fun and engrossing. Can't wait for the next installment.

This a great idea of the adventure game format. It has great atmosphere, the system is easy to use, and the use of video helps to drive the story. It really was an interactive movie, and I hope more adventures games use this format in some way. If you love detective stories, adventure games, and solving a mystery, then this is the game for you.

Well put together. If you enjoy classic Gumshoe adventures like Clue and LA Noire, this is a fun puzzle. Hoping to play another game like this soon and maybe even a sequel to find out more about the seemingly sinister Rand's and their club, Atlas.

It's rare nowadays that a game can keep me captivated to play it from start to finish and not feel like I'm bored or wasting my time. Contradiction is one of those games. Sure the acting is kind of cheesy (Especially Jenks) and there is a lot of repitiveness as you have to go back and ask everyone everytime you learn something new, but it creates the feel of being a dectective in one of those British murder mystery shows like Midsomer Murders perfectly. I hope this is succesful enough to create a sequel or another adventure featuring Jenks. It's not for everyone, but it's just fun. Well worth your time and money, even if there is literally zero replayability to it

Fun game, like watching a really campy murder mystery with some interaction thrown in. The acting really did it--Inspector Jenks is so cute I want to watch him solve more murders. Was also impressed at how high-quality it was. Pity there isn't any replayability, so it's pretty much a one-shot game.

It is a mixed bag but I mostly enjoyed my time with Contradiction, mainly because it is really nice to see the effort of reviving the FMV genre with the help of contemporary technical means. The acting is still as amazingly cheesy as it was decades ago but the shots of course look way nicer than before.  I give this a recommendation although I have two major complaints:  1) This will be familiar to players of the Ace Attorney series. Throughout the game you spot contradictions and facts that just don't add up, but you're sadly restricted to point out the contradictions the game wants you to spot at the appropriate times. The game would hugely profit if there was a way to give more freedom to the players and their own wits. Ways to actually FAIL, different ways to tackle the same problem and things like that.  2) Mild spoiler alert. People who want to buy the game should stop reading here.  The game sets a lot of conflict up and admits itself that Jenks has only scratched the surface of what is going on in the story. This of course stirs the appetite for a sequel but the problem is, that it really devalues the game as a whole. The payoff of the whole murder mystery is quite meager compared to the huge setup(s) which might leave some players dissatisfied at the end.

Really like the game. This is the first time I played a FMV game and was surprised by how much fun I had. The actors are great (yes, even Jenks :) I just love his quirkiness) and for me personally the controlls are very smooth. Even though sometimes I had trouble figuring out what to do, I could always look at the tips provided by the game.   I really hope the developer will create another FMV game in the near future! I am definitely a fan now :) Go Jenks!

I'll be short on what I didn't like. There is an over-abundance of information, and trying to figure out contradictions among it all can be quite hard. And unless you get contradictions, you can't make any progress. So often times I felt like I was beating my head against a wall.  But the game is brilliant. It feels so amazing when you do get a contridiction. And the video aspect of it is, in my opinion, a better choice than whatever 3d digital world/characters someone could have made. The story was pretty interesting, the characters pretty unique, and I couldn't stop thinking about the game once I started playing.  The ending felt a little weak, and it left some unanswered questions.  I would 100% buy another game like this for around $10-$15. Maybe spend a little more if the game was a little bigger and made by this same company.  Very fun game, would recommend it to anyone who likes challenging puzzles.

I bought a copy for myself and one for my 20 year old daughter. We were both glued to this game,..  I gotta say, its AWESOME! Its like a throwback to some of the games from the mid 90's, like Phantasmagoria, etc.. but far better. You will really have to have your thinking cap on. It also keeps a desire in your heart to solve it on your own, with no help. Although cheats are built into the game if you  are endlessly stuck. I was tempted to use them but didnt. I cant wait for the next installment!
Surpsisingly good!  There is a bit of a problem at the end of the game regarding broken window, but overall I like the acting in this game and the game plau  10/10

Excellent murder mystery game, which would be amazing even without the FMV. The contradiction system works superbly 90% of the time, the characters are deep and varied, and new locations open up all the time.  Some will say that the game doesn't hand out enough clues. I'll say this is patently false. On top of the hint system, players can call the Chief, and even get flat-out cheats to help them along when needed. The ever-increasing amount of conversation points also means that the amount of answers to verify grows as well -- but that just means you can't be expected to simply throw statements at one another hoping they will stick. One has to fully remember everything to get around in Contradiction.  The most disheartening thing I have seen regarding this game is the Rock Paper Shotgun review for it. By saying the game should directly tell the players when new events are available at locations, when contradictions are left to be made -- and with whom -- the author only put his inability to appreciate freedom on display. TellTale's The Walking Dead this is not. This is very much a game, and not an interactive story. The only valid point that review brought forth is the game's technical shortcomings; it is true that the lack of resolution options is jarring, and the general UI and presentation is odd at first. But not only is it absolutely not a deal breaker, I feel like it kind of gave the game a very distinct, simple vibe. It was never distracting or frustrating. It took me a couple of minutes to get used to it, then I never gave it a thought again.  Really, for all fans of classic, hardcore adventure games, looking for a modern take (in terms of presentation) on the classic genre, Contradiction is a gift from the Gods. Do not hesitate. Do not watch trailers. Do not try to know anything about it, except that it is a great, great game. Just dive in, headfirst. You'll thank me!

I was a huge fan of Tex Murphy, and when I saw this I bought it asap. I'm only about 40% done but its been very enjoyable so far. The controls were clunky at the beginning, then I fixed the control setup and now everything runs smoothly. The only reason I'm writing this review is to let you know of an exploit in the game. I try my very best to do everything on my own, but there has been 2 times that I was at a lost, so I used a cheat. If you care about achievements, using a cheat will hinder most achievements that you can earn. So the exploit, save the game, use the cheat, then load that game. You still get the info from the cheat, but it doesn't actually use a cheat. I didn't even mean to come across this, I actually loaded the game back for a different reason and then I was like, oh hey, look at that. But anyways, this game is really well done for an FMV style game. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes FMV or just a good mystery.
An excellent mystery story that was fun from start to finish. VERY FUNZ!
Exactly what I wanted.
Love it. Great value for the price. Controls are a little difficult at the moment but it's a pleasure to play and watch. Scratches that old time FMV adventure game itch.
This is a really fun and interesting independent game! It's worth the money. I hope they gain enough support to make the sequel. I know they have mine.

A simple must play. If you enjoy murder mysteries. A girl was drowned under dubious circumstances in an english town, and a inspector is investigating the death. He only has a few hours to come to the conclusion. Was it an accident, a suicide or a murder.   By talking to the main characters in the game you have to find out what's happening. That also means you have to spot the lies that those people tell you.   The game makes use of good actors and creates the right atmosphere, especially if you take the low budget they got into care. Spot on!   Let's hope they come up with a sequel...!

Rather interesting live-action video point and click adventure. The main character's quirkiness and facial expressions were quite amusing, and, overall, I felt that all the actors did a great job in portraying their characters; without spoiling anything, I can say that I am looking forward to more stories starring Inspector Jenks!  With regard to the actual gameplay mechanics I was pleasantly surprised by the lack of a hidden object aspect; the storytelling was well-paced, and no aspect of the tale felt anticlimatic at all (quite the opposite, actually).  I would definitely recommend this game, it reminded me of Dracula Unleashed, another live-action adventure from the 7th Guest era (1993-ish), making it all the more fun. Thumbs up to the developers, will definitely be expecting a sequel!
One of the best detective/mystery games I've ever played. Looking forward to a (much needed) sequel.
this game is great. very well done. i can't wait for the next one!
Fun for what it is. Good casual game :-)

A very well crafted game with a compelling user interface. They say that this game was created on a tiny budget and it shows but not in any place important. The actors were very good--they could be (and probably have been) on any quality BBC production. With a larger budget, they could make the sequel this this truly fantastic. For example, in this game the characters were always interviewed in the same place. Ryan seemed to have an endless glass of whiskey over the many hours that the game takes place. Simon always appears to be in a bright afternoon kitchen even at 11:00 PM. And Inspector Jenks doesn't have a mobile phone but has to return to a pay phone.  Having the next sequel end with one of the classic mystery wrap ups where you have everyone in the same room and reveal the actual murderer would cost a lot because you would have to record many different video takes that would not be used. However, the fun there would be you could replay the ending multiple times.  I played this game with my wife and we enjoyed it as much as a good British mystery series--maybe a bit more because it was interactive. I hope that everyone likes this game as much as I did so that the sequel will be created with a larger budget.
Very few story driven games would be worth playing through a second time. This is one of them.
Very fun murder mystery, controls didn't bother me as much as some people. I'd like to see more games in this style!
Solid game with a nice Story.

A really interesting game, a total flashback to FMVs of the past. The game breezes through a few hours of your time with genuine mystery and intrigue, with loads of different threads that need pulling together. Most of them are not tied up by the end which leaves the game open for a sequel.  The main character is the weakest part of the game, with very strange directional decisions taken with his acting (no police detective would behave so immaturely when handling sensitive issues) but other than that the acting quality is pretty good.   The finale, I have to say, was poor, with the game seemingly ending abruptly with a solution that technically could have been arrived at hours earlier, but a sequel will definitley be intriguing.  Hats of to Paul Darrow for his Rickman-esque performance as well. A definite highlight!

I enjoyed this game and finished it in a couple of days. It felt like an average quality murder mystery television episode made into a game. Apart from the cutscenes, it only has a single game mechanic. The story can't proceed until you spot who's lying. Some of the lies were obvious. Others I had to use the 'cheats' for, and even then, they didn't feel very contradictory. But for the most part, they were very satisfying to solve. Probably played better in marathon streches because otherwise you'll forget the clues that you need to spot the contradictions.

There are virtually no words to describe this game. All I can say is wow it was amazing and wow it was really heavy. I look forward to anything more like it that comes out in the future. This was the first film based game i have ever played. Now I have a very high expectation of them and would love to play more. I hope a sequal comes out. 10/10 I think everyone should play this game.

Loved this game! Refreshingly unique and I really enjoyed the challenge of building up the case in my own head, Absolutely worth trying if you are a fan of point-and-click style games.  My only piece of constructive criticism was thatit became apparent very early on who the 'bad guys' were. Plot twists notwithstanding, I would have appreciated a game in which all characters come across as more or less innocent from the beginning. If there is a sequel maybe a Clue style format in which you ultimately have to make an accusation from a selection of suspects could help with this?  In any case, tremendous fun and highly imaginative. Thank you for your visionary work, I will certainly be looking forward to a sequel!

Absolutely loved this game! I was fully immersed from beginning to end, and felt adequately challenged throughout. Inspector Jenks is a charismatic protagonist who I would very much love to see in further sordid investigations!

Amazing game. Has a few frustrating hitches, but with close examination and trial and error they can be overcome making the story engaging and fun. I'd recommend this game to anyone who loves murder mystery intrigue!
Game is awesome. Worth the time and money. If you like murder mysteries, this isthe game for you.

Interactive detective movie in a small village. This game was like a breath of fresh air - good concept - very well implemented with good script and slick editing for modest cast - quite fun - best tried with friends or family together with output to TV screen - occasional rare minor interface bugs but easily overcome - some scenes and acting quirky and quaint but all the funnier for that - there is enough for a couple of evenings or one very long one - would fit in with a weekend effort with friends or family nicely.   Was very happy to forgive any minor shortcomings of this game because overall the effort and polish of what was attempted was accomplished very impressively; it is not easy to script, edit, act out and film such a work so well - the developers have done a good job on this - appreciate it and I hope you will enjoy this interactive TV detective show as much as we did.   I picked it up when on a heavily discounted price tag and found it great value entertainment - I don't often review games but this delivered what I was expecting and was fun - deserves support, success and sequels.
A very intertaining and brilliant created game!
Recommend! Fun game!

In one sentence: Doctor Who, P.I.  Old-school style interactive movie. Unlike games from the 90's developers of Contradiction are better filmmakers than game developers, and somehow it's the game's biggest adventage.
This was a great game. It challenges your thinking in multiple ways, and above all definitely entertaining. Problem is it has very little replay value. But I hope there is a sequel

Great game! Really enjoyable, wonderful story and world-building. I escpecially love how the 'baddies' have a business called Atlas [Shrugged] and are named [Ayn] Rand, and the way it equates right-wing capitalist individualism with the very similar principles espoused by Satanism in order to give it a spooky aura. Also loved Jenks' campy style! My criticism would be that the final contradiction that cracks the suspect was something I noticed towards the very start of the game and thus had that suspect in mind throughout and wasn't shocked at the outcome.

This is a really beautiful experince. The acting is superb and the plot is really nice to follow.   You are required to find the contradictions in the explanations of the characters as the game develops. You listen and you then need to point out where the problems are.   You can take it down in 8-10h but it is definitely worth it.

I had hesitations going into a purely FMV game, but wow this won me over. It's a really interesting classic adventure style game that is carried by great acting. This is, despite having its plot unfolding around a murder, a comedy narrative as each character delivers some hilarious dialog. The only complaint I have is that at times I wasn't completely sure what to do next so I had to stumble around attempting to put things together (and even if I had figured something out Jenks still may be behind logically). This is a pretty standard complaint for adventure games, however the fact that every piece of info is there in the menu means that obsolete info or items remain despite having no further function... minor complaint though as I wanted to see more of Jenks. I hope the cast returns for a sequel as this game really builds towards an interesting world I'd love to see more of.
Very good and cleverly made game! actors are of high quality, feels like being in midsomer murders episode. Waiting for a new game
This game was _amazing_. Highly reccommended! Not just a fun game but a legitimately gripping story all the way through!

I think I haven't played such a well executed FMV adventure since forever.   This is clearly the result of a very dedicated work and the scenes look amazing. Also, the actors are great in their roles and the story gets interesting really fast. There is a hook for a sequel at the end, but the main story concludes in a satisfactory manner.   Pros: - Really well acted and directed FMV adventure game. Decent soundtrack, too. It's incredible that all this was accomplished on a short budget. - Interesting way of navigating around the locations. - Virtually no pixel hunting. - The UI helps a lot in order not to get stuck - and if you use up hints and chief calls and still don't have clue, there is also a 'cheat' system to power through your predicament.  - It is not really a short game, or at least doesn't feel like it. It takes its time and you get to meet and get to know most of its (multiple) characters quite well.   Couple of drawbacks: - The gameplay is mostly backtracking over locations to interrogate/ ask questions based on new info you discover. However, there is a three-level hint system integrated in the game that assures that you will never get stuck - 1 or 2 of the (several) contradictions that you are required to spot seemed a bit far fetched.  A definite recommendation from me to anyone who enjoys FMV adventures.

Entertaining crime investigation game that you can spend few hours with. There aren't any alternative endings and you cannot apprehend innocent people. But it still is a solid murder mystery adventure and there aren't too many of those around so I hope they'll keep making these.
Great game and a lot of fun to play with friends. Best played on a big screen TV with more than one person. Looking forward to a sequal!
If you enjoyed either LA Noire or Pheonix Wright, this is definitely the game for you.
The genre I never knew I have been missing out on all this time.
Hilarious

Inspector Jenks could give Columbo a run for his money with the amount of popping in and out of people's homes to ask 'one more question' dozens of times in the space of a few hours. And with all that walking about, is probably ther most buff, athletic policeman ever to grace the force.  It's not without its flaws, but a fine detective game for the price. The acting is decent and the storyline progresses well. Some of the contradictions are a bit obscure and a search filter would have been handy for sorting through the lists once they got lengthy enough, but overall the enjoyment outweighed the nitpicking, and I'd enjoy seeing a sequel to this.

Overall, this was a fun mystery for anyone who may want to play detective. The main character, Detective Jenks, played by Rupert Booth, was a bit on the goofy side, which keeps the story light and fun. The background music (By Tom Follin) sets the tone perfectly. Paul Darrow gives a brilliant performance as the sinister Paul Rand--the sort of character you love to hate. The story was a bit strange, but this kept things interesting. My only real complaints are:  1) the game mechanic in which you must spot the contradiction from the same character--this became a bit of a frustration in that you might spot a contradiction between two characters but be unable to pursue it. 2) Once you start, don't plan on doing anything else for the next twelve hours.  I recommend this game. It's a bargain.

This game is a cosy investigation played out in gorgeous FMV segments. You progress the story by walking between locations in a sort of Google Maps fashion, and interviewing the characters you find in the hopes of making them contradict themselves. The overall feeling is one that players in the UK will recognize if I say 'weekend evening ITV murder mystery'. It's a police procedural that has more in common with Poirot than The Bill.  The core mechanic gets a bit wobbly once you're a couple of hours in, because the list of available topics is so long that it's impossible to hold it all in your head at once, and spotting contradictions is a matter of scrolling up and down the list, reading off each point at a time until something you spot something. And them hoping that the game recognizes it as a contradiction, because not every instance of contradictory text is necessarily something that will move the game forward.  It's charming in setting and cinematography, and the acting is winningly hammy, so the niggles with the problem-solving fade away, especially since a lot of it is easy enough that you can just keep propelling the story forward.
A must pick up if you love whodunnit style mysteries. Was hooked beginning to end.

Very fun FMV detective game. Story unfolds at a nice pace, puzzles are at a sufficient difficulty, and the acting is well above average for this genre. Hoping to see a sequel- there's so much more to uncover in this case!

Very fun FMV detective game. Story unfolds at a nice pace, puzzles are at a sufficient difficulty, and the acting is well above average for this genre. Hoping to see a sequel- there's so much more to uncover in this case!
Whole family got in on this.Well acted and like solving a tv murder mystery with you in it.

At first you will think 'lol, this game is so cheesy', but give it time and you will LOVE the characters and the plot. Jenks is a legend. Really fun take on a point and click mystery game. Excellent fun to play with others. The game has tricky moments that will take a good deal of lateral thinking. Fingers crossed for... 'have you ever seen this ........sequel before?'

Let me say that I'm fairly sure that this is the first game I have ever reviewed, I love it that much. From the over the top goofy-ness of Jenks to the story that ends up really sucking you in, this game was a thrill to play. I would love to see some kind of sequel that wraps up what was left out of the ending.  One issue of FMV games for me was the hard contrast of the actual game and then the video footage used that made it seem out of place in games like Realm of the Haunting, but this game was seamless and was a very well done interactive story and I loved every bit of it.

The contradiction conversation mechanic is interesting, & sometimes requires a decent amount of thought to execute. There's an annoying tendency for the game to require wandering around in unimportant areas in order to spawn seemingly random events to advance the plot, but overall it's an enjoyable little puzzle-solving experience.

This game is very simplistic and linear. You basicly wonder around asking questions, investigating and trying to piece together what happened. It is very simple premise, but the game does that beautifuly! You really get drawn into the story and listen carefuly to what any given character is saying, trying to remember it all since every single detail can be later used to spot the Contradicion and catch someone on a lie. Well acted, very interesting and visauly pleasing. Worth the fulll price. Must buy if you like adventure games and/or detective stories.
Excellent game ! I recommend it. An interactive film made and worthy of the best policing investigations, in the purest British style. :)
Thought this game was great. Well worth the money and kept us intrigued throughout. There needs to be a sequel!

Great game. Very reminscent of old school FMV games like the Tex Murphy series, or some of Sierra's FMV adventure games. I recommend this to any fans of the genre. I really hope there are some sequels or spin offs from this as it was a lot of fun. Acting was fairly good for this kind of game with memorable characters.

A strong aspect of this game is in the acting, comedians ranging from good to very talented. Searching for contradictions in the characters statements, which is the mechanic of the game, becomes somewhat a chore when, towards the end, you have to browse among the many answers collected all along the inquiry. But, I did not mind using a walkthrough, just for the pleasure of advancing at a fast pace in the story and closing it. The pleasure was akin, but not as rich, to playing the good old Phantasmagoria 2. (By the way, if you liked Contradiction, you may love this one.) Halas, troubling is the fact that the game ends with a promise of a sequel, which is necessary regarding the many loose ends... though comments from the developer on the forum remain vague and conditional on the subject. What is he waiting for? People who played the game are begging to throw money at crowd-founding for this project. And why not? With Contradiction, the dev has proved to be a talented and trustworthy movie/game director. We are waiting for more.

I have never reviewed a game before on Steam despite my large number of them largely because most others are already saying what I think. But having just completed this game I see this as highly recommended. Yet I feel like I was just traumatized. The last two sessions I played of this were simply because I was pot commited and I wanted to see how the story ended. It's hard for me to articulate why exactly I dislike this game without some degree of spoiling but I won't so don't worry.   The tragedy of this game is that the start showed such promise and the writing was solid. But by the end of the game the lack of technical polish and writing chops is so visible to be painful. It tears me up to be this negative because i'm sure this was put together by a passionate group of good folks. But the eponomous Contradictions range from vaguely clever to unbelievably convoluted and obtuse. Further the climax and final chapter is contrived to the point of being laughable. Characters suddenly do things for no reason and the ultimate reveal is so anti-climactic but is played straight to the point of mellow drama.  To put it concisely this game ran out of something, I don't know if it was money, or time, or patience. But this bears all the signs of someone setting out for something much grander, but then having it all collapse and having to build something workable out of the ashes. A noble effort, but do not waste your time like I wasted mine.
Not as exciting as watching a detective movie... Too many unrelated details and monotonous game play experience, The story itself is far from attracting...

I really want to like it.  The concept is fantastic.  But I felt it was force fed to me. It's obvious who I'm meant to be suspicious of to start. It's like it's trying to make sure I'm completely biased towards them, and then so it can feed me a revelation later on.  The 'Detective' breaks so many obvious rules of collecting evidence. Everyone puts their hands on unbaggaged evidence for example.  The real issue though is the acting. It's obviously an indie game, but I wish they could have had better actors. The actors overact so very much. It's really hard to feel empathy, or strongly about a game when I feel it's a bit of a pantomime.

How did literally the most BASIC of game design bugs make it past QA for this game.   There's a bug which once you press a button on your controller, breaks the keybindings and you cannot control the game again correctly without reinstalling. Why would you not program the ability to click on the menu options.  Note: 'Case Background Info' and 'Current Tip' are not a game options. Game options are things like, resolution, controls/bindings, a/v, subtitles, etc.  No full screen or resolution settings.. Come on, these are 10 Dollar features I would hope.  And I really am excited about this game. It looks like the video portion was very well thought out. I don't get why the game UI and controls wern't.   My review may change if I can get the bloody thing working.
